node.title: Scientists Use Extreme Stars to Test the Limits of Albert Einstein's Greatest Theory
node.description: Physicists tried for 16 years to find flaws in Albert Einstein's ground-breaking theory of general relativity, which is the best description of gravity we have.

node.title: Fearing Border Closure After Presidential Election, Migrants Coming to Chile in Droves
node.description: Many migrants are treating the Dec. 19 runoff presidential election as the deadline for when to cross over, fearing an anti-immigration candidate could win.

node.title: U.S. Banks Collected $6.13B in Overdraft Fees Over 9 Months, Yet Many Are Eliminating Them
node.description: Banks collect overdraft fees when customers pay or withdraw more money than they have in their account.

node.title: Pfizer Says COVID-19 Pill Reduces Death, Hospitalization by 89 Percent in Final Studies
node.description: The pill, called Paxlovid, is currently being petitioned with the FDA for emergency-use authorization.

node.title: Kentucky Raises $6M for Tornado Victims in 72 Hours, Toy Drive Ongoing for Kids' Gifts
node.description: The state's first lady set up a children's toy drive for families affected by the tornados. They request unwrapped books, toys and $25 gift cards for families.

node.title: People Are Swooning Over Viral Christmas Display That's Been Viewed Over 1M Times
node.description: The TikToker synchronized their lights and a projector on the garage door to DMX's "Ruff Ryders' Anthem."

node.title: Afghan Drone Strike Survivors Angry U.S. Troops Won't Be Punished, Still Await Relocation
node.description: "We have heard nothing," said one of Zemerai Ahmadi's brothers. "The longer it takes, the more dangerous it is for us."

node.title: 'Misogyny is Rampant': Ashley Kosak Says Male SpaceX Co-Workers Routinely Groped Her
node.description: "A fellow intern approached me in our intern housing and grabbed my butt while I was washing my dishes," Ashley Kosak, the former SpaceX engineer wrote.

node.title: Sterlin Harjo Can Do a Lot More Than ‘Reservation Dogs’
node.description: The filmmaker directed “Love and Fury,” a Netflix documentary about Native American artists, before his hit Hulu series.

node.title: Geminid Meteor Shower: How to Watch Its Peak in Night Skies
node.description: A picture from the meteor shower in 2020 highlights how brilliant this winter sky show can be.

node.title: China Won't Talk Arms Control with U.S. on Earth, Biden Seeks A Deal in Space
node.description: "China really is that second, number two behind the United States in space, so I think they recognize that. I think they want to be seen more as a peer in this area," a State Department official told Newsweek.

node.title: 3 Out of the Top 6 Biggest Cities in America Now Have Vaccine Mandates
node.description: "We just don't want to go back to where we were a year ago and it's really not that much of a burden to ask people to be vaccinated," said Philadelphia Mayor Jim Kenney.

node.title: Deputy charged with throwing scalding water on mentally ill inmate
node.description: The inmate suffered first- and second-degree burns but wasn't treated for about 6 1/2 hours, authorities said.

node.title: At Amazon Site, Tornado Collided With Company’s Peak Delivery Season
node.description: Amazon, which has its highest employment during the holiday shopping season, said the tornado formed at the site’s parking lot.

node.title: At Least 17 COVID Patients in South Korea Died Waiting for Hospital Beds Amid Surge
node.description: Many health experts are now calling on the South Korean government to reimpose social distancing measures.

node.title: Decision to Attend Christmas Party May Have Saved Couple From Kentucky Tornado
node.description: "If I did not go that Christmas party, I would not be here," Stephanie Matheny of Mayfield, Kentucky, said.

node.title: Woman Charged With Killing Disabled Son Had Him Drink Washer Fluid to 'Free Him': Police
node.description: Mary Diehl initially told police her son likely died after suffocating in his bedding.

node.title: Fox News hosts urged Meadows to get Trump to stop Jan. 6 attack, texts show
node.description: The messages were among the reams of documents Meadows turned over to the committee before he stopped cooperating with investigators.

node.title: How Did Turkey’s Economy Go So Wrong?
node.description: Even before the pandemic, Turkey was trying to ward off financial meltdown. The crisis has accelerated as President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has doubled down on his unorthodox policies.

node.title: The Omicron variant could cause fewer hospitalizations, an early South African study shows.
node.description: The findings, which also show that the new variant decreases the efficacy of the Pfizer vaccine, are based on only three weeks of data, and epidemiologists have cautioned that more data is needed.

node.title: Despite Omicron's takeover, expert says South Africa "in a good space"
node.description: Unlike previous COVID variants, Omicron has not brought a spike in hospitalizations. One vaccinologist thanks natural immunity, and says it will be a "true test" for the vaccines.

node.title: Watch Live: Kentucky governor holds briefing on tornado aftermath
node.description: At least 88 people died in a weekend outbreak of severe storms and tornadoes, including at least 74 in Kentucky.

node.title: John Cameron Mitchell Finds Joy in Mavis Staples and ‘Veneno’
node.description: On the eve of concerts celebrating “Hedwig and the Angry Inch,” the writer and performer also shares why “The Gnostic Gospels” feeds his soul.

node.title: It’s an Interactive Experience, Charlie Brown!
node.description: An adventure awaits visitors in Honolulu in “The Search for Snoopy,” starting in March.

node.title: A Witty Mastermind of Les Ballets Trockadero Comes Home
node.description: Peter Anastos returns to the comedic troupe he helped found for “Nightcrawlers,” a Jerome Robbins sendup at the Joyce Theater.

node.title: Why I Keep Writing About Dive Bars
node.description: Attracted to the grit, equality and community of those modest watering holes, a Times reporter has worked them into his coverage.

node.title: Pornhub's Most Commonly Searched-For Fictional Characters Revealed
node.description: As part of its Year in Review feature, Pornhub has revealed which characters in movies, cartoons and video games have been searched for the most in 2021.

node.title: Pornhub Reveals Gen Z, Millennials and Boomers' Search Behavior in 2021 Review
node.description: The 2021 Pornhub Year in Review feature shows some surprising differences between the adult video consumption of those in Gen Z, millennials and boomers.

node.title: More Than $6.5 Million Raised To Help Families in Tornado-Ravaged Kentucky
node.description: A series of GoFundMe pages have collected more than $250,000, while donors contributed more than $6.25 million to the Team Western Kentucky Tornado Relief Fund.

node.title: Around 40 people killed in Haiti fuel truck blast as the country weathers economic and political crises
node.description: Dozens more people were injured as the truck filled with gasoline exploded in the latest disaster to hit a country whose troubles deepened greatly this year.
